profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2019-02-25 22:11:03 UTC.

change.item: EAD was imported spring 2019 as part of the ArchivesSpace Phase II migration.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: In XV Series: Series I: Cataloged materials: Correspondence, Manuscripts and Prints by Other Artists -- Series II: Cataloged Manuacripts, Prints by others, etc. -- Series III: Titled Drawings, Lithographs, Prints and Proofs -- Series IV: Advertising -- Series V: Architecture -- Series VI: Book Illustration -- Series VII: Bookplates -- Series VIII: Exhibitions -- Series VIX: Magazine Illustrations -- Series X: Posters -- Series XI: Other Categories -- Series XII: Miscellaneous Drafts and Sketches-Early Work -- Series XIII: Miscellaneous Printed Materials -- Series XIV: Articles, Broadside, Clippings, Obituaries, and Photographs -- Series XV: Additions to the Collection.

odd.head: General Note
odd.p: Other collections of Rockwell Kent materials are at: SUNY-Plattsburgh (Rockwell Kent Collection); National Museum of American Art, Smithsonian Institution (Peter A. Juley & Son Collection, Photographs); Archives of American Art (Ken Papers); & Princeton University Library (Graphic Arts-Kentiana)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: A comprehensive collection of working drawings and sketches, watercolor paintings, lithographs, proofs, manuscripts, and architectural drawings. There are illustrations for many books including Moby Dick, Beowulf, The Canterbury Tales, The Decameron, Paul Bunyan, Candide, and The Bridge of San Luis Rey, as well as illustrations for 18 of Kent's own books; bookplates for many well known people, magazine illustrations, advertising, posters, and graphic art work of many other types. Some correspondence is included, as well as many lithographs and woodblock prints by Kent's students and admirers.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of specific item; Date (if known); Rockwell Kent papers; Box and Folder; Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Columbia University Library.

userestrict.head: Terms Governing Use and Reproduction
userestrict.p: Single photocopies may be made for research purposes. The RBML maintains ownership of the physical material only. Copyright remains with the creator and his/her heirs. The responsibility to secure copyright permission rests with the patron.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: American artist, travel writer, and political activist.
